definition: hearts linked as one, just as the proverbial rhinoceros communicates emotion telepathically through his single horn (idiom); fig. two hearts beat as one
pinyin: xin1 you3 ling2 xi1 yi1 dian3 tong1

definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: This time the husband and the wife finally reached a perfect mutual understanding.
sentences.chinese: 這次，夫妻倆終於心有靈犀一點通。

definition: lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
cups and dishes in complete disorder (idiom); after a riotous drinking party
white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
